intro: Jacobinia crenata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Jacobinia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from pale blue to pink, bloom during the summer months. Jacobinia crenata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
